author: kpedro88
body:
The new aging features introduced in this PR are primarily intended to be used for HB Phase2 TDR studies, but can also be used for nearer-term HE studies.

Scintillator radiation damage:
* New classes `HBHEDarkening`, `HBHERecalibration`
* Headers describe the ingredients/models
* Can be configured for HB or HE (in Python)
* `HBHEDarkeningAnalyzer` prints out darkening and recalibration factors for given lumi:
```
cmsRun CalibCalorimetry/HcalPlugins/test/hbhedarkeninganalyzer_cfg.py
```

SiPM radiation damage:
* New class `HcalSiPMRadiationDamage`
* Header describes the ingredients (simple parameterization of dark current vs. temperature, lumi/dose)
* Can be configured for HB or HE (in Python)
* Dark current updated in hardcode conditions - can be dumped to see values
* Zero suppression thresholds may need to be updated for high lumis - not investigated yet
* Had to add hack in `HBHEPhase1Reconstructor` to account for dark current contribution to pedestal mean (only enabled for phase2), eventually this can be redone in a better way - attn: @abdoulline, @igv4321, @mariadalfonso 

Add aging and recalibration to cmsRun config:
```
from SLHCUpgradeSimulations.Configuration.aging import ageHcal
process = ageHcal(process,3000)
```

***NOTA BENE*** model parameters in Python are ***NOT*** final and may change, depending on ongoing studies!

See [presentation](https://indico.cern.ch/event/623426/contributions/2520814/attachments/1431939/2200131/phase2_hcal_software_status_mar_22_2017.pdf) in last week's upgrade studies meeting; a more in-depth presentation will be given during upcoming CMS week.
title: Updated radiation damage models for HBHE scintillator and SiPMs
